name: Hatsune Miku: Project Diva F 2nd
summary: Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA F 2nd is a rhythm game, and is the direct sequel to Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA F. The game is set to have a similar play style to its predecessor whilst featuring new songs, returning songs from previous games, and character modules. New in-game mechanisms original to the game include sliding touchscreen notes, and double scratch notes. The DIVA room also features various minigames that can be played, including a clapping game. Another new addition to Project DIVA F 2nd over the previous game is the ability to change skins for the rhythm game mode, where decorative skin designs can be downloaded as DLC. The game features cross-save support between PS Vita and PS3 systems.

alternative_names.name: 初音ミク Project DIVA F 2nd

esrb.synopsis: This is a rhythm game in which players tap buttons in time with music videos starring a variety of anime-style characters. Players score points by accurately matching timed cues as they appear on screen. Some female characters wear revealing outfits such as short skirts and low-cut tops that expose large amounts of cleavage. Image galleries also depict female characters in provocative poses. Videos occasionally contain brief scenes of violence: dancers in a field striking each other with swords. One song references alcohol in the lyrics (e.g., “Let it 'clover club' the beautiful love/And don't forget the dry gin”); the accompanying video depicts bottles of gin.

pegi.synopsis:
The content of this game is suitable for persons aged 7 years and over only.
It contains: Violence that is not shown but is implied
